intro: Zexmenia melastomacea, commonly known as the coastal melastome, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal dunes and scrublands. It produces capsule fruits that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Zexmenia melastomacea is an important component of coastal ecosystems, contributing to biodiversity and soil stabilization.
